title: Task 18

question.text: What does not at all mean in simple conversations?

answers.answer: It means you agree with what was said
answers.feedback: Not at all is used for saying no or it was not a problem, not for agreeing.

answers.answer: It means you really don't want something or that you are ok with what was said
It means you don't understand what the other person said
answers.feedback: Not at all doesn't mean confusion. It means no problem or just no.

answers.answer: It means you'd like the person to repeat what they said
answers.feedback: This phrase is not about asking for repetition, but about saying no problem or simply no, I don't agree.

description: Not at all is a simple phrase in English used to say no in a strong way or to answer thank you. When someone says thank you, you can say not at all to tell them it was easy or no problem.
